snippet: The Louisiana Supreme Court issued a stay just before Mayor Mitch Landrieu would have been confined in a dispute between the city and its firefighters.
abstract: Louisiana Supreme Court issues stay on court order that would have placed New Orleans Mayor Mitch Landrieu under house arrest for failure to concoct plan to pay city's firefighters $75 million in back pay; court does not indicate how long stay will last or next steps in case.
lead_paragraph: The Louisiana Supreme Court issued a stay just before Mayor Mitch Landrieu would have been confined in a dispute between the city and its firefighters.

headline.main: New Orleans Mayor Avoids House Arrest in Labor Dispute
headline.print_headline: Mayor Avoids House Arrest in Dispute
